column2: NEBRASKA DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?
column6: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.
column8: Yield.
column10: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.

column2: 2. When you see this sign you should:
column4: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.
column6: prepare to slow down and possibly yield to oncoming traffic.
column8: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.
column10: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.

column2: 3. What is the meaning of red traffic signs?
column6: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.
column8: High emphasis warning.

column2: 4. Rumble strips are intended to:
column4: alert drowsy or inattentive drivers that their vehicles has left the road.
column6: indicate that a stop is ahead.
column8: help slow the vehicle in case of brake failure.

column2: 5. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column6: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.
column8: reduce the reaction distance.
column10: leave more space in front of their vehicle.

column2: 6. The yield sign is ___ and white, with ___ letters.
column8: red; red

column2: 7. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.
column6: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.
column8: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.

column2: 8. If you are involved in a crash and must move an injured person, you should:
column4: keep the back and neck as straight as possible.
column6: pull the victim feet first away from the danger.
column8: if there are wires down, go near them.
column10: None of the above answers is correct.

column2: 9. Vehicles may not follow any fire apparatus traveling in an emergency status closer than:
column8: 200 feet

column2: 10. Before passing another vehicle, you should signal:
column6: early enough so other drivers know your intention.
column8: just before changing lanes.

column2: 11. Driver distractions include:
column4: Slowing down to look at crash scene.
column8: turning your headlights on when rain and fog make it hard to see.

column2: 12. You can pass on the right:
column4: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.
column6: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.
column8: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.
column10: when passing is restricted by parked cars.

column2: 13. On roadways, bicyclists are considered:
column8: vehicles.

column2: 14. When approaching a highway-rail intersection, the first sign drivers see is usually:
column8: an RXR round sign on a yellow background.

column2: 15. This sign means:
column4: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.
column8: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.

column2: 16. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column4: Not drinking over a period of time.
column8: Drinking coffee.
column10: Eating before or while you drink.

column2: 17. Reaction time is slower:
column8: after a day at work.

column2: 18. This road sign means:
column8: No U-turn

column2: 19. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column4: Look through your back window for children.
column6: Get out of the car and check behind the car.
column8: Rely on your mirrors.

column2: 20. Destination signs are ______ with ____ letters and symbols.
column8: white; black

column2: 21. What does a flashing left yellow arrow mean?
column4: Vehicles turning left must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column8: Left turns are allowed. Yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.

column2: 22. When passing another car, you have enough room to return to the driving lane when:
column4: you cannot see the vehicle directly to your right.
column6: you are at least 50 feet in front of the vehicle.
column8: you can see both headlights of the car you passed in your rearview mirror.
column10: you have cleared the front bumper of the passed vehicle.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column8: The road ahead curves right, then left
column10: A side road merges from the left

column2: 24. When approaching snow removal equipment, drivers should:
column4: maintain a following distance of 100 feet.
column8: be aware of flying sand and chunks of ice and snow.

column2: 25. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
column6: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.
column8: Stop only if you are sure that the vehicle is headed toward you in the opposite lane.
column10: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.
